title: Dual Brane Pairs, Chains and the Bekenstein-Hawking Entropy
abstract: Dual Euclidean brane pairs of type II String- and M-Theory wrapping a two-sphere are used to express the D=4 Bekenstein-Hawking entropy of a non-rotating D=4 spacetime in terms of a product of the branes' Nambu-Goto actions. For this we identify the sphere with the event-horizon of the D=4 spacetime. Working in the strongly-coupled regime, we propose to relate a Euclidean brane's tension to the inverse of a smallest volume unit. The ensuing discretization of the branes' worldvolumes makes it possible to consider long chains. By counting their number we can reproduce the D=4 Bekenstein-Hawking entropy and its logarithmic correction.
